intro: Hyperanthera cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam, and thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant features showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, with intricate petal structures. Its root system is fibrous, and it often grows in shaded, moist forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
